articles.description: Manchester City host Liverpool in a game that could shape the course of the title race - with Jurgen Klopp saying his team must take their chances.
articles.title: 'The strongest team in the world' - can Liverpool stop Man City?

articles.description: Sir Elton John says getting manager Graham Taylor to Watford was one of the greatest moments of his life and he still goes "crazy" supporting the team.
articles.title: 'One of my greatest moments' - Sir Elton John on his love of Watford

articles.description: The former Paralympian has been serving a 13-year sentence for murdering girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.
articles.title: Oscar Pistorius to be freed on parole

articles.description: Sean Dyche says Everton feel "aggrieved" at the "disproportionate" 10-point deduction for breaching financial rules.
articles.title: Everton 'aggrieved' at 'enormity' of sanction - Dyche

articles.description: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz and Haas driver Nico Hulkenberg both crashed in an eventful Friday practice at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.
articles.title: Leclerc tops Abu Dhabi practice as Sainz crashes

articles.description: Liberia manager Ansu Keita on how death threats from fans forced him to miss a 2026 World Cup qualifier.
articles.title: 'Let them kill me' - Liberia boss on death threats

articles.description: Katie Taylor and Chantelle Cameron make weight for Saturday's rematch in Dublin, on the morning after riots in the city centre.
articles.title: Taylor & Cameron make weight against backdrop of riots

articles.description: Former Manchester City and Liverpool striker Mario Balotelli is "in good health" after being involved in a car accident.
articles.title: Balotelli 'in good health' after car accident

articles.description: As part of Howard Webb's drive, as head of refereeing, to improve standards around VAR, pilots and air traffic controllers are helping England's top football officials.
articles.title: Pilots drafted in to help England's top referees

articles.description: Pep Guardiola insists the 115 Premier League financial charges against Manchester City and Everton's points deduction are "completely different" cases and cannot be compared.
articles.title: Man City case different to Everton's - Guardiola
